subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests
msgSnippet: ... Again, I think there is some misunderstanding. I think Eugene is referring to the scenario where your TestCase is created in a suite and is passed
messageBody:
On 10/18/05, Robert Watkins <yahoo@...> wrote:
>
> On 10/19/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
> > I wish your statement would be true. Unfortunately it only work for
> > statically bound test cases. If tests are returned from the suite
> > method that is adding them dynamically (e.g. from external config or
> > captured data) in my knowledge none of the IDE would allow to restart
> > specific test case and you'll have to run the whole suite.
>
> Umm.... it works for me in Eclipse and in IntelliJ. I simply click on
> the failing test and select "Run".
>
> And I use the data-driven test approach extensively as well.


Again, I think there is some misunderstanding.

I think Eugene is referring to the scenario where your TestCase is created
in a suite and is passed parameters in its constructor.

In this case, just pointing at the test method and clicking on Run will
obviously run the test method with the default value, not the one with the
right parameter.

As I said, it's a problem that is independent of the testing framework you
use (and I actually have figured out a way for the TestNG Eclipse plug-in to
directly use a @DataProvider for that, so that all you need to do is to
point Eclipse to the data provider you want to use and it will invoke the
test with that specific data).

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
